abstract: Supreme Court appears poised to allow Los Angeles police to conduct inspections of hotel and motel guest registries without permission from judge in effort to crack down on drug trafficking, prostitution and other criminal activities that take place at such establishments; some motel owners object to proposal.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court debated whether the police can inspect guest registries without a judge’s permission.

headline.main: Supreme Court May Be Open to Hotel Registry Checks
headline.print_headline: Court May Be Open to Hotel Registry Checks

snippet: The Supreme Court debated whether the police can inspect guest registries without a judge’s permission.
